intro: Lappula nana, commonly known as dwarf lappula, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant has small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, and its leaves are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Lappula nana is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
